Reviews.Title: “Right in the action”
Reviews.Author: Mavsman15
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple nights here while in Maui. We had a great time. The rooms are nice. We had a great time drinking on the lanai facing front street and people watching. The restaurant downstairs serves a pretty good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location!”
Reviews.Author: KimJ_in_Oregon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Best Western Pioneer Inn. The rooms were clean and spacious with a small lanai (pool-facing) and mini-fridge. The pool was small but clean and the right temperature. We read books on the chairs while our children swam and frolicked. The hotel has beautiful landscaping around the pool, making it feel slightly hidden. We ate breakfast 3 times at the hotel's restaurant and got prompt, pleasant service each time. Our children loved the open air restaurant and the daring birds that would wait to be feed scraps. The breakfast prices were a bit high, but we got a discount for staying at the hotel so it evened out. The location of the hotel was the best part! We were right along the water and we got front row seats for watching the fireworks out over the water. We could walk next door to the artist's market. One morning, I got up early and went for a walk in the downtown area. It was peaceful to watch the small town waking up. We were also centrally located near several nice restaurants, an ice cream parlor, a museum and the location for our surfing lessons. What a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: winecountrylovers
Reviews.Content: The Pioneer Inn may not be a mega resort but just being in Maui is sometimes all you need. If you don't need all of the hoopla of a Mega Resort then this is the place. The only drawback is that you can't cook any meals. It is located right in the heart of Lahaina and close to everything. The front desk ladies are very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and bed is comfortable. You can't beat the price for the location. The breakfasts at the local restaurant were excellent. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry P
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel situated right at the waterfront well worth the visit

Reviews.Title: “Location very convenient”
Reviews.Author: judylamb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights as we were taking ferries and the hotel is directly across from the harbour. It is very old but has recently been renovated. The first night we required 2 rooms and as we were 3 they olny had 1 room for 3 that was already booked so it turned out to be quite expensive. The bed was amazing! Nive to have an outside balcony. The second time we stayed they accommodated us with providing a cot in the room. The fold out cot was absolutely terrible, the worst I have ever slept on; they need to provide better folding beds. there was also little room to move in the room, ended up taking some furniture out to the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olufh
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming, and very quiet and comfortable. Staff is great

Reviews.Title: “does the trick...”
Reviews.Author: stantsy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 nights at the Pioneer Inn. The place is basically no-nonsense. The rooms, small but do the trick (note-single beds). Bathroom was great, shower pressure excellent. Restaurant in the Pioneer Inn had great breakfasts, the staff were friendly and it really is all about location. Anything in Lahaina is a walk away from your bed at the Pioneer Inn. Don't expect the Ritz but if you are low maintenance than the Pioneer Inn is for you. Mahalo to the Pioneer Inn, hopefully one day I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pioneer Inn”
Reviews.Author: TomV55
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a few nights in downtown Lahaina. Right in the middle of town, across the street from the Banyon tree and the marina. Only problem we had was the parking is limited. During the busy season (holiday week), the lot they use can fill up. It happened to us, and we parked in another similar lot and ended up with a $40.00 parking ticket. I told the front desk clerk what happened, and they did not want to help with the ticket. After getting the manager, I was able to get him to slpit the cost with me. Anyway, watch out for that, they told me they have a second lot available, but you have to come back to the front desk to get a second parking pass, Otherwise, nice basic hotel in a great location. Love Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a short stay in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: laGuera
Reviews.Content: Quick, solo, 4 night trip to Maui, and decided on Lahaina and the Pioneer Inn for convenience, and because of my Best Western points. It allowed me to walk and take the bus almost everywhere because of it's convenient location. Across from the Marina, and right in the middle of everything. Enjoyed the nice, little pool. The room was fine, clean, comfortable-- everything I needed since I didn't spend much time in the room. The bed was great, very comfortable. Bath towels on the smaller side, but in good shape. Pool towels were varied. Wifi worked fine. I had an interior courtyard room, nice and quiet, and liked the little balcony that looked out over the patio and pool. Nice little breeze in the early evening. Hotel is not on the beach, but you can walk a couple blocks to the beach or drive or take the bus to check out several different beaches. The restaurant has a good happy hour, and on certain days, great appetizer offers. If you want a resort, right on the beach, with full amenities, this is not the place for you on Maui. But if you just want a good, convenient place to stay in Lahaina, close to everything, Pioneer Inn is the right place at a fairly good price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: niki032
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found ourselves at the Best Western Pioneer Inn after a mistake in the scheduling of our condo. We had to find a place to stay for our first night on Maui and this hotel has rooms available so we booked one for a night. We actually ended up being very happy that this happened because this hotel was great! We had dinner at the hotel restaurant, which had good food. The hotel is located in the middle of the shopping district of Lahaina. There are MANY shops and restaurants within walking distance. There are also a few bars nearby, with some great live bands. A word of advice: if you plan to go to bed early, be sure to ask for a room away from the main road. Our room had an adorable little balcony on it that looked out onto the busy street, but we could hear the music from the bars across the street all night and it made it difficult to sleep. That is my only complaint about this place. Everything else was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: saeunpark
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Pioneer Inn last year in May. The rooms were well maintained and housekeeping was extremely clean. The rooms are not very spacious, but unless you have children running around it is completely adequate. Considering the age of the building, the rooms are very well maintained with modern bathrooms that are kept meticulously clean. The location is superb! It is situated right in front of the harbour, giving easy access to water activities including whale watching(the boat docks right across the street!). The hotel also has a great restaurant with the most friendliest staff I have met! They are all smiles and are always ready to help! The hotel is also situated smack in the middle of the main street making it very convenient to just walk out to shops and restaurants. This also does mean that it gets slightly noisy at night. I had trouble falling asleep some nights due to the noise from the bars and restaurants around the hotel. But, unless you're on a trip for pure relaxation away from all the noise, you just can't beat the location! Another important point is that there is no elevator going up, which means that you will need to lug your stuff up some steep stairs. So if you have alot of heavy luggage you may find it uncomfortable. Other than that I had a great stay at the hotel without having to waste anytime getting to places as everything was right at our doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: coachpate
Reviews.Content: After checking out of another hotel early due to discomfort, the Best Western Pioneer Inn was a wonderful change. The staff was so friendly, they made you want to stay. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms have a nice refridgerator for your cool drinks. Lahaina gets very quiet shortly after midnight and there are plenty of places with great food. Well worth the money. A hugh variety of interesting shops. Parking is close and free, along with free internet access. The bath towels are thick and soft. A very pleasant place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: CALag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. It is a very small room, but it was clean and the staff was very nice and the location can't be beat if you want to be on Front St. The lanai is large and comfortable and looks out on the action. Beware that the louvred bathroom door allows little privacy and that you will hear the street noise until around 1am and that it will start again early in the morning. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OregonLadee
Reviews.Content: I had a very unfortunate turn of events while in Maui and needed a place to stay late one night after discovering I was in the company of bedbugs where I was supposed to stay! Anne at the front desk was incredibly helpful and professional about the whole matter, and was able to accommodate me for the remaining two nights of my trip (minus my bags at first, of course. I thoroughly laundered and cleaned everything before my belongings rejoined me!). Thank you so much to the Pioneer Inn for saving me! The hotel was clean, quiet (I was on the courtyard side), and very comfortable, and the location can't be beat! Although it is older, everything was very well kept up - I like the retro style!

Reviews.Title: “Another part of our once in a lifetime trip....”
Reviews.Author: Paul N
Reviews.Content: Since we drive so much each day in our lives, we wanted to reside for several days without the need for a car.....The Pioneer Inn centrally located in Ole Lahaina Town was the natural choice. With the wharf just across the street our charter fishing trip was a few minutes away. The shops, majic show, restaurants, all within minutes of walking....The staff and adjoining restaurant and bar fit into our plans. The artesian and their wares under the Banyan Tree.....well the list goes on and on. Even more, if you watch at The Devil at Four O;Clock, with the exception of some modifications to the surrounding area it still looks the same....If you appreaciate the romance of Old Havaii, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay on the ocean or if catching the ferry”
Reviews.Author: ElementTent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after arriving from the Lana'i ferry. The location is only a few steps from the ferry terminal which worked great. The view from the hotel is fantastic and the park next door is nice. The rooms are a little dated, but it is a old hotel. Only negatives are the Banyan tree next door has quite a few loud birds during the day and early evening. Also the band playing downstairs can be heard loudly at night, unless your air conditioner is on. We enjoyed our stay at the Pioneer Inn and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: morticia52
Reviews.Content: Our second time in Maui, and our second time at the Pioneer Inn. We adore this hotel, it's got so much character (not the seen one of the chain .... seen them all variety). It's in the centre of town so all the restaurants and shops are within easy walking distance, but more to the point the staff at the Pioneer Inn are so friendly and helpful - you tell me in what other hotel the receptionist (the lovely Katherine) would offer to lend you her library card because you had run out of books to read?? And really that sets the tone for all of the staff, nothing is too much trouble and they are all only too ready and willing to go that extra mile to make your stay wonderful. Staying on the rooms on Front Street won't be right for you if you are 'light sleepers' because the action goes on into the early morning but it suits us because we can sleep through anything and one of the highlights for us is sitting on the balcony and 'people watching' with a drink in hand late in the evening - or sometimes with a coffee early morning (and this time we had a 'Grandstand View' of the Maui Marathon which went right down Front Street) I hope we get back to Maui sometime because we love the island and if we do it will definitely be another stay at the Pioneer Inn. Oh and a special mention for Alex the African Grey Parrott in the bar for making everyone laugh with his repertoire!!

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: valliesverige
Reviews.Content: best location in lahaina!I had no car so I came by bus from kahaului,but I was in the middle of the center of that nice little town in Maui.nice staff at the reception and very helpful (my key smagnetized 2),I love the coffee facility in the room,the lanai just up on front street,It was funny to see people walking just under your balcony! and I luckly had a smoking room (not so frequent in the Us!).A bit noisy at night (because of the central street,but at about 11 pm the noise stops..)

Reviews.Title: “A great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo435
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and have been to Maui more times than we can count. We used to go every year for several years. We always stay in Lahaina. The Lahaina Shores is great but late at night those extra 3 blocks can seem like a mile. When we know we want to spend time in town, we stay at the Pioneer Inn. This is a historic hotel right smack in the middle of town. We've tried the Resorts of Kaanapali but they seem so commercial. Great for folks with kiddies who need to be entertained. But for us adults, we like hangin' in Lahaina. The Pioneer Inn is not like a resort. They have a great restaurant downstairs that is perfect for breakfast or happy hour entertainment. The pool is a hidden gem. Behind the busy ships of front street in an inner courtyard surrounded by trees is a small pool. A great place to relax after a long day sightseeing. The rooms are not overly large, but are clean and well appointed. Plan on dropping off your luggage and going for a walk or a meal to allow the AC to cool your room down because they do not leave it on unless the room is rented Â Once on though it can keep your room cool all day and night and ready for you after a long day in the sun. Very green of them. The hallways are not air conditioned and get hot. So don't dawdle in the hallway. Likewise no elevator so pack light. If you like to people watch get a front street or harbor view room. If you like peace and quiet get a courtroom view. Each room has a wonderful covered lanai with a table and chairs. You can sit and relax, rehydrate, chat with your fellow guests, or just watch the scenery. The staff is always helpful. Don't be afraid to ask for anything. They usually have beach chairs you can borrow to sit in the park across the way where you can relax, enjoy the ocean breezes, and watch the boats come in and out. Â This hotel is not fancy, but is a great value and is right in town.Â

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jacky a
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for 6 nights. Very friendly people and lovely comfortable room with a great bed, air-conditioning and free wireless internet (which we didn't even have at the Hilton!). The first couple of nights we stayed in a room at the streetside which was lovely until Thursday night there was a very loud outside disco with a very enthusiastic dj right next to the hotel which kept us up straight in bed until 1.30 am. Apparently they have this often during the weekend and we later heard it usually stops at around 11 pm). We asked for another room (at the patio/pool site) and this was no problem, the receptionists were very friendly and helpful. In this room we no problems with the noise at all. Great location, right in the center of a lovely town and lots of nice shops and beach outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: BumBleB83
Reviews.Content: Great location, we will definitely stay there again.. Free parking, great staff and they will give you discount on onsite restaurant..

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyColonel
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Maui before and picked the Pioneer Inn based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. This hotel is not for you if you're looking for a resort setting. Try Kaanapali up the coast instead. What you will get here is a historic hotel with a lot of character that is well run and very clean. The Pioneer Inn is in the middle of everything and although I had a corner room for 9 days facing the street and harbour, I did not experience a noise problem. There's only 33 rooms in the hotel so there's a cozy atmosphere and both Katherine and Ann on the front desk were always great to deal with. The hotel owner lives on-site and it's obvious both the hotel and restaurant are tightly run operations. I patronized the restaurant numerous times because it was fairly priced (15% discount provided by the hotel) and the service and food were always perfect. If you want to travel to some of the other islands, ferries to Lanai and Molokai leave from right outside the front door. There are also companies offering parasailing, diving, deep sea fishing, submarine rides and so on as well. Maui has a pretty good bus system and the bus station is a minute walk from the hotel. It's possible to go to Kahului for a $1 or all over on 10 routes with a $2 day pass. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel in heart of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiGirl05
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel at the habour. It is a older hotel but it is clean and well kept. This hotel is well liked. Shops and nice restaurant on site and nice view of harbour. Not as expensive as hotels in the Ka'anapali area, but very close only 5-10 minute drive. I would recommend staying here for anyone who has a tight budget. If you want clean nice rooms without being really fancy this is your place. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Yes, we really did love it!”
Reviews.Author: KYProf
Reviews.Content: The Pioneer Inn is a historic hotel right in the middle of honky-tonk Lahaina, Maui, a former whaling town. It is in a block of buildings that forms a hollow square, containing shops on two sides and a restaurant as well as the hotel. Our room was on the second floor facing the courtyard. It had a balcony with table and chairs from which we enjoyed the courtyard, which contained a nice swimming pool in the midst of beautiful plantings. The room was nicely furnished, with a comfortable bed. Some might call it small, but remember that this is a historic building. The bathroom had excellent, stylish fixtures, and the best hotel towels we encountered in our nine days in the islands. The wharf was right across the street, for those who wanted boat rides or snorkeling trips, and a beach was next door. A huge variety of restaurants and shops is within walking distance. Despite the throngs of people on the sidewalks at night, the inside rooms had no noise problem at all. The desk clerk was very friendly and helpful when we had questions. Free parking is available a short block away. We loved the old-fashioned atmosphere of this hotel and will definitely stay there again if/when we return to Lahaina. We would rather stay there than at the upscale resorts up the road in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Had to leave after first night”
Reviews.Author: Instalater
Reviews.Content: Booked it as a reward stay for 3 nights with my wife. Small room, muggy smell, kind of mildewy. A note on the night stand said they will fumigate the next day and to please let the exterminators into the room. Noisy and busy area, the birds make such a noise starting around 5am. Not much chance to change anything when you arrive at 1am. We left in the morning to find the new hotel after a breakfast in the on site restaurant, which was actually very good.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Motel”
Reviews.Author: arrbarr
Reviews.Content: Definitely would recommend this hotel for a night in Lahaina. It's an old historic hotel, and during it's time was probably something grand. It is dated for sure, but it's very clean and comfortable. Old style air conditioners in the rooms - but better than nothing. The service was fantastic at both the front desk and restaurant. Great big balconies that look over the inner courtyard. We were there as a couple but this would also be a great hotel for families . The prices are very reasonable for Hawaii. The restaurant was nice, open air - right next to the Marina. Thee friendly hotel parrot "Alex" was very entertaining and cute as can be. Great little local find for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: louseason
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness we did not spend too much time inside our hotel room, because it was just average. The decor and bedding were old, and the room had this muggy, sticky feeling. In order to reach the AC we had to stand on a chair to turn it on. Otherwise, you'd have to rely on this fan hanging over the bed. The bed was also way too soft for my taste and the pillows were ridiculously thick. Our room had a great view of the Banyan tree, which was nice. And the location was good if you want to explore Front street. My main issue with this hotel was its excessive noise level at night. If I hadn't brought my earplugs, I know I wouldn't have been able to sleep. In fact, I could still hear loud music and nose through my earplugs. If you're a heavy sleeper, then you should be OK.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: jymhawk
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, big room, comfortable Murphy bed. Great location by the marina and easy walking distance to a good surfing/snorkeling beach. It also has an excellent restaurant on site at very reasonable prices, and lodgers get 15% off. Only drawbacks: all rooms are on the second floor and there's no elevator, no on-site parking, but free parking is available nearby, and louvered door to bathroom (the one place you don't want airflow). These were all very minor problems for us and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree and Ocean Breeze”
Reviews.Author: GarynPatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first leg of our Maui trip. We arrived around 11pm and were greeted with a friendly smile. Our room was clean and looked to recently updated. The bed was very comfortable and the square pillow we perfect. Our Lanai gave us a view of the Banyan Tree, harbor and the west mountains. Upon arrival we also received a parking pass that allowed us to park in a lot about 100 yards from the hotel which saved us at least $20 a day. They have a nice courtyard and the onsite restaurant was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ColBSouthCoast
Reviews.Content: The Pioneer Inn is the place to stay on Maui. It is located right on the center of the best town on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The most charming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SlowRoadRider
Reviews.Content: The silly Best Western website does not do this place justice. Beautiful, charming, historic hotel in a great location. Rooms along the road can be noisy but I sleep through anything so not a problem for me. Nice staff, none of the over-service of much of America.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: MountainVoyager
Reviews.Content: The Pioneer has a great location. The main harbor in Lahaina is right out the front door and Front street is out the back. Outdoor pool is nice and clean. WiFi signal was weak in room 19. Decent size in room refridge The front desk is great when Anne is working.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Experience: Bed Bugs.”
Reviews.Author: Voidman
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay at the Pioneer Inn and will definitely be our last. We stayed in room 36 which is a corner room with a wrap around lanai. Since we had stayed here before in a different room, we thought we knew what to expect, but when we walked into the room the smell was nearly unbearable. It smelled as if the room was filled with old gym shoes. Every time we came back to our room we opened both lanai doors to try and air out the room. What we didn't realize was the room was infested with bed bugs. My wife got the worst of it with over a hundred little bites on her arms and legs. We also had a couple bug come back in our luggage and we are cleaning and bagging everything to try and stop the infestation from following us home. We obviously no longer recommend staying at this hotel. It has turned into a nightmare for us.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations - Big Time !”
Reviews.Author: howster44
Reviews.Content: Great location close to all desirable attractions. Friendly, helpful staff. (Thanks Anne !) Good restaurant with acceptable menu. Room was very clean, well stocked and comfortable. Amazing how they maintained a comfortable room in a historic building. We recommend booking a room overlooking the courtyard and pool. Much quieter. Outside hotel the scenery was amazing. History, tourist amenities, and a beautiful harbour right there for you. Would definitely stay there again. Mahalo !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: emltravels
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for a few hours, we arrived late and left early to go to the sunrise at Haleakala but it was in a great location with great service. The woman at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful in giving us directions. The restaurant attached was closing soon after we arrived but the bartender was willing and able to get the cook to prepare us a meal. All in all it was a great experience, and seemed like it would have been a lively place to be during the day as it was lined with shops. We did not get to check out the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: mcalbreeze
Reviews.Content: This is a great location especially if you plan any tours out of the harbor. Our trip was a weekend trip and specifically to take a snorkeling/whale watching tour that left out of the harbor...early! Because we were tight on time location was what sold us on the Pioneer Inn. The hotel was actually better than I expected. We had a king room with a harbor view. The view was actually a park view and you could see the harbor too. I loved the terrace! It was great for people watching. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and we slept very well. The parking is not that far from the hotel. You can unload your luggage at the hoteland then park the car. The location was in the center of shopping, restaurants and the park so we walked everywhere and everything was within an easy walk. We had lunch at the hotel restaurant and though it was very good. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it. It is not a resort hotel and doesn't offer a beach for swimming. If I had been staying longer than a weekend and were on vacation I would have wanted a resort hotel. For us this was perfect because we were able to catch our 7:30am snorkeling/whale watch tour by very easily walking across to the harbor and then easily head for the shower at the hotel when we were back!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL! BEST LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Trip36
Reviews.Content: Actually I was here 2 years ago. ThatÂ´s a good hotel in a wonderfull location. The best point to reach all island. Confort hotel, big room and a good balcony with a great view. They offer a park few blocks away. And staff are OK. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “has character”
Reviews.Author: noyesse
Reviews.Content: I am always attracted to old, quaint inns with a little history. This place fit the bill perfectly. Right on the Lahaina Harbor and smack in the middle of town. We had the corner room with the king bed and it was plenty roomy. It did smell like stale cigarette smoke, however, and if you are a light sleeper, the street noise may hamper your sleeping. Didn't bother me a bit. The pool was clean, although we didn't take the time to enjoy it. The restaurant served a decent breakfast at a reasonable price. Parking is free, but across the road and behind another building...not a problem. No elevators so you have to hoof it up the steps to the rooms, which are all on the second floor. Some people complained about the noise from the AC. I, personally, didn't even notice it the one time we actually turned it on. All in all, we loved the Pioneer Inn, but were only there two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but in need of better staff”
Reviews.Author: IMADALEY1023
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Pioneer Inn in Lahaina is placed in a perfect location. Walking distance from shops and the beach, a great way to experience the town of Lahaina. The restuarant onsite was great and the service was great there. The one thing that we had a problem with was the front desk staff, particularly a young woman who I shall remain nameless. She was very unpleasant towards us and she needs some help with hospitality. Other than that, this place is a great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and best of both worlds.”
Reviews.Author: trippinkpj
Reviews.Content: This property is the best of being both a historical inn with the modern ammenities of being in a Best Western. Clean and modern with free Wifi and parking less than a block away. The parking lot is much closer than it used to be. Pool was very clean, hallways could be cleaner. Great location on Front street close to dining and shopping.. We had a room that faced the pool area and it was very quiet. We also had a partial harbor view. Very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great 100+ year hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: cxbonne
Reviews.Content: Charming older hotel right in the Lahaina shopping loop and directly in front of the pier. Certainly recommended to those who also enjoy a comfortable hotel with history. If your looking for a resort you probably need to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Voidman
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay in Lahaina. The historic hotel is old and creaky but that's part of the charm. We enjoyed sitting on our lanai at the end of the night and watching the people stumble along Front Street. The noise level can we quite loud in the mornings. Most of it can be drowned out by the A/C. We found the service here to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby colonial charm at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: UJ99
Reviews.Content: Location â€“ Located right by the harbor, this is the best location in Lahaina. We chose it as we were doing two of the cruises offered by the Pacific Whale foundation, and were able to walk out of the front of the hotel, and almost right on to the boat. The Inn sits beside a huge banyan tree and park. You are at one end of the main drag, Front Street, so everything is within walking distance. We were able to get from the airport to here by the (highly recommended!) bus system for just $2/person! From the bus stop behind the Wharf building it is just a 3 minute walk to the hotel. Check-in â€“ Very smooth. We were politely greeted by the desk clerk who had our reservation at hand. She gave us the lay of the land, explained how to charge to the room, gave us the 15% off dining coupon which we could get more of, and answered our questions, all in a welcoming manner. We also were told that we could get a 15% discount at Hula Cookies and Ice Cream, just around the corner (highly recommended!). Room â€“ Donâ€™t expect hi-tech or chic! This building is over 100 years old (also no elevator, but just one flight of stairs), and that does show in places. We booked a harbor view (the other view being the hotel courtyard), but this would more accurately be described as a park view. You can see the harbor quite well, but the majority of your view is the park across the street. However, there is a very nice sized lanai with table and chairs, which is a nice place to sit of an evening. Just be sure to keep your balcony door locked, as the lanai are all joined, divided only by low wooden railings. A safe in the room would also be a welcome addition. The room is pretty plain, and could probably do with a makeover, but is serviceable. Old fashioned TV, but it worked and had a decent basic cable lineup. As other reviewers have said, the AC can be loud, but it never woke me up, and the fan was fine for most of the time. The other loud noise for those with a room overlooking the park is the birds that gather at dawn/dusk. Not too bad at dusk, but may wake you at dawn if you donâ€™t have the A/C on (didnâ€™t wake me). Bathroom, as with bedroom, is fine but nothing special. Toiletries were provided but were run of the mill Best Western. Restaurant â€“ We ate breakfast here a couple times and enjoyed it. The service was good; the waitress was quick with the coffee refills. The food was a little over priced, but then you are in Hawaii and you are paying for more than the cost of your food. The views are great â€“ coffee and excellent pancakes while watching the harbor canâ€™t be beat. The only downside was the rather loud parrot in a cage in the bar! We also partook of the Happy Hour here which is excellent! Really good value and the bartender is super friendly. They have a good selection of draft beers (the Big Wave is recommended), and for the cocktails, he does not hold back on the alcohol! Nothing can beat having a good drink whilst watching the sunset over the harbor right from your barstool. Amenities â€“ Not many! But Iâ€™d rather have the antique plantation charm of the building as is than a characterless nondescript concrete monolith just to have an Olympic pool or fitness center. If that is your bag, go up the coast to the resorts. There is a pool, but it is small. There is WiFi in the rooms. The courtyard is nice, but canâ€™t compete with the views of the harbor or the shade of the Banyan tree in the park. Checkout â€“ Accurate, polite fast and efficient â€“ what else could you want? Overall, I loved staying here. If you donâ€™t want to have to walk, carry your bags or take some stairs, and want a mega-pool and never to have to leave the grounds, go to a Kaâ€™anapali resort. If you want a place that has a real charm and a location and price that cannot be bettered, stay here â€“ you wonâ€™t find better in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the thick of it.”
Reviews.Author: shelbymom
Reviews.Content: We chose the Pioneer Inn because we like to be walking distance to area attractions, restaurants and bars and we also like historic hotels. It kind of reminded me of places in New Orleans in its look and feel. Our room had a nice lanai that faced the Banyan tree in the park next door. I had wondered if the noise from being located downtown would be problem, but it wasn't. Whether that was because we were on the side of the building, away from Front Street, or because when the A/C is on it's rather loud I don't know, but we didn't have any problem with noise. The parking is a few blocks away. It's free, which is rare. We just pulled up to the hotel, dropped our stuff, I checked us into the hotel and my husband went to park the car. No big deal. Very nice staff in the hotel and in the restaurant/bar. Used the 15% off coupon they provide to have breakfast there every morning. Good stuff. We spent three nights here so that we could enjoy the town of Lahaina and then went up the coast to The Sheraton for our last two nights and enjoyed the ocean and the different world that staying in a resort provides. Loved'em both and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice historic building”
Reviews.Author: DKAC_Voyager
Reviews.Content: In the hart of Lahaina. First hotel in Maui I beleive built in the early 1900. Old style but very nice and clean. Lots of shops and restaurents walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Charming older hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandmato2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built around the turn of the century. It is right on Lahaina harbor and on Front street where the shopping is terrific. It is across the street from the huge banyan tree. We love older hotels and this one was great. The only down side was no elevator to the second floor. Our lanai looked out on a beautiful garden with a pool. There is a good restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Another Memorable Stay at the Pioneer Inn”
Reviews.Author: mahalo544
Reviews.Content: Another fine stay at the Pioneer Inn. I'll continue to stay here when traveling to Maui alone. It's not a 5 star hotel by any means but if you are looking for a room with A/C and free wireless, within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants, friendly staff, free parking (although a 3 block walk), nice tv, fridge in the room, next to the pier, and the fact that its a historic hotel built in 1901, then this is the perfect place. I've stayed here my last three visits to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: denonweaver
Reviews.Content: My wife & I made an impromptu trip to Maui & actually found the Pioneer Inn through Expedia 30 minutes prior to departure from LAX. The hotel is centrally located with lots of shopping & water activities literally across the street! We were in a modest size room in good order. It was very clean with minimal insect problems. Our main complaint would be the lack of counter space in the bathroom. All rooms are on the 2nd floor & there is no elevator so be prepared! The restaurant has very good breakfast items at reasonable costs & the service is good. The bar has a nice beer selection but I'd stay away from the margaritas. Not good at all! Be prepared to listen to the bird who lives there. Beach is not so great, very narrow, not too clean.

Reviews.Title: “Dispelling the Myths; The Definitive Report on the Pioneer Inn”
Reviews.Author: travelerwiehe
Reviews.Content: Having family on Maui, I visit the island quite frequently and have stayed in a variety of accommodations. After reading all the TA reviews and considering the tight budget this most recent trip entailed, we chose to give the Pioneer Inn a shot. The first and most important qualifier is expectations. If you are looking for ocean view, resort style, semi-luxury, then the Pioneer Inn is not the place for you. Trying to compare it to that style of Kaanapali type hotel, as many reviewers have done, is really not fair because in truth, no, it is not as nice. But it will also run you half the price. So as long as you consider what you are paying, you will not be unhappy with your choice. The room was smallish, but comfortable for three, very clean and recently remodeled. There is a little bit of street noise, but it dies down in the evening. Actually being right in the middle of Lahaina town is the fun part. Front Street is an awesome experience, and you will be minutes walk to restaurants, shops, grocery stores, etc. AC cools the room down just fine and does not turn off and on by motion sensor as some one previously stated. It does make some noise being a wall unit, but no more then any other wall unit type of air conditioning employed by many a chain hotel. We actually felt the noise a bonus. If you are being bothered by outside sound like music from the restaurants, early morning harbor traffic, or the birds in the Banyon Tree, just close the door and turn on the AC to drown it out, and sleep like a champ. Many reviewers said they couldnâ€™t stay more then a couple of days, but we stayed over a week quite comfortably. In addition to the roomâ€™s low cost, the free parking and discount at the restaurant downstairs compounded the savings. With the extra money we were able to do much more with the rest of the vacation and you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the wharf, for me it was a...”
Reviews.Author: photokev
Reviews.Content: Right on the wharf, for me it was a perfect location. The rooms were small but very nice for an old historical building. I was on the east side overlooking the park which was nice. All the rooms on this side had a lanai with chairs. The only downside was the morning street noise. The restaurant downstairs was really nice for breakfast, I ate at kimo's for dinner (which I also recommend) I paid 120 a night here which was a steal for Lahaina. I'd have paid much more just for the location. If you're looking for a resort experience this isn't it but if you're looking for the perfect base to explore Lahaina from, this is your place

Reviews.Title: “Historical inn with a great view”
Reviews.Author: nikitangel
Reviews.Content: We were flying through Maui and taking the ferry to Molokai, so we picked the Pioneer Inn for its location. The ferry literally picks up from the parking lot, which was very convenient. There is no shuttle from the airport, so we had to make other arrangements. Check-in was moderately fast and easy. The room was adequate, with a nice little balcony. Unfortunately, the windows were painted shut, so we had to prop the door open to get any air moving. For awhile, we left the hallway door open as well, hoping to get a little air flow. The pool was nice enough, but it got chilly as soon as the sun sunk low enough to put it all in the shade. It was also a little dirty, in that lots of leaves and things were floating in it. The inn is next to a beautiful park with a banyan tree, which we really enjoyed exploring. We were able to walk to dinner both nights (the hotel restaurant didn't really appeal to me, but I don't like seafood much). The view of the ocean is nice, but there isn't really anywhere beach-y, so no swimming in the sea while we were there. We'd planned on spending the day in Maui and taking the evening ferry, but ended up leaving in the morning after all. It felt like we'd "done" the area in an afternoon and evening, and we didn't want to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayflower60
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Pioneer, as a last minute option to staying in Kahului, and we were so happy we did. This hotel is in the heart of Lahaina, with all the action, good restaurants, shopping. We had a garden view room, instead of a view of the street or Banyon tree, and the room was very quiet, clean, spacious, lovely lanai to the pool/garden area, and the free wifi worked great! Rates were reasonable for the area, staff very helpful, received a discount in the restaurant. We had a great experience, and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Maui hotel”
Reviews.Author: Born2travel2
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat this location and at a price we can afford. Located on thw wharf in Lahaina, centrally located for restaurants and attractions. The Maui bus is a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Hawaii hotel away from the glitz of modern resorts.”
Reviews.Author: dunera
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a whaling Inn and bar in 1900 in the capital of Hawaii at that time, Lahaina. Now a Best Western it has 50 rooms which have been renovated in period style. All have woodern balconies, ( get one overlooking the banyan tree in the town square with ocean views. ) Lahaina is a big touist attraction on Maui and between 10am and 4pm is very crowded but outside these times you have the town to yourself.There is an attractive inner courtyard where you can eat and a main restaurant on the harbour. There is also a small shaded pool area. The restaurant is ok but nothing special. Wine list is ok.No car parking on site but free vouch for parking 300 yards away.Rooms are average size with wireless internet access and multi channel tv.The hotel is generally quiet but there can be some noise from locals and traffic in the evenings also much birdsong in the bannyan tree at 5 /6 am! I found the hotel delightful with a friendly staff. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed stay at quaint hotel in maui”
Reviews.Author: OregonNorwegian
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at a quaint hotel in lahaina, maui, the Pioneer Inn. The location and staff were wonderful; right in the midst of the city, on the bay by the ferry. The staff was so helpful with our many questions and even let us borrow a cell charger for our stay. The hotel is across the street from the famous Banyan Tree. Loved the coffee shop/cafe on the other side of the library. Reasonable rates and free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for Sight-seeing all over Maui”
Reviews.Author: LadyDragonFly
Reviews.Content: Depending on what you want to do, Maui has all types of accomodations to suit your purpose. On the northwest side, Kaanapali is where all the resorts or most of the resorts are located while Lahaina is the historic town where shops, art galleries and restaurants are situated. To the north of Lahina and Kaanapili is Napili, where developments occurred earlier and where condos are situated but where one can also have excellent views, beaches and where that good restaurant The Gazebo is located . On the south is Kihei where most condos are as well and further south is Wailea where some luxury resorts are. We've already spent a week or so in Honolulu and on the North Beach when we decided to explore Maui. Pioneer Inn is a centrally located and offered good value ($119 per night) and I heeded the advice of one of the Trip Advisors to stay either in Kaanapali or Lahaina. We also realized that we would not be staying most of the time at the hotel to explore Maui.The truths - it's true that the airconditioner feels like there is a loud person in the room. It is also equally true that the walls seem to be thin enough to hear the people next door. Room 30 was our room and we have to tell you that it does not have a refrigerator. Good thing that we have a huge cooler from Costco (it is within the airport area so Costco members note this because you can get your supplies from here)! It is also true that Pioneer Inn is by the wharf where you can watch the sunset and that it overlooks a centuries old gorgeous banyan tree. It is also close by art galleries, grocery stores and restaurants. In short, it is conveniently located. It maybe a bit of a drive from Haleakala and Hana as compared to Kihei and Wailea but as I've said I agree with the other Trip Advisor who suggested to stay on the Northwestern side (Kaanapali and Lahaina). If you're looking for resort type accomodations, please don't expect it at Pioneer Inn. Also, if you're flying straight from the mainland and looking for a great beach that is steps from the hotel, this is not the place for you. The beach is a few blocks away (505 Street) and is not impressive. Pioneer Inn is a great place to sleep after you've done snorkeling or drove all over Maui to see what makes Maui - Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but noisy”
Reviews.Author: wbforever
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Pioneer Inn was for fine just one night. I'd read mixed reviews on this hotel so I wasn't expecting a 5 star hotel. With that in mind, it was fine for one night. I wouldn't want to stay there for 5 nights though. This hotel is centrally located in downtown Lahaina and good for those who love the night life and like to stay out all hours of the night. The room was clean but the air conditioner (window mount - worked great) was really loud. When the air conditioner was on it did drown out the noise from neighbors and people on the street. If you like the night life, you won't mind the noise and this is a great location to stay. If you have kids or like a good nights sleep - I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but check the AC before you go to bed”
Reviews.Author: rockohorse
Reviews.Content: The location is good - really good since its downtown Lahaina. Plus it was cheap. The air conditioner was really really loud - that said we didn't actually notice until it was late at night and all the exterior noise from the people outside the hotel died down - and we didn't complain to the hotel, I'm guessing that we could have got another room, but we only stayed one night so we didn't give t much thought. As for a previous post I read - yes, no elevators, but one flight of stairs is not going to kill you. Parking is kind of far, best to drop your bags at the hotel and then take your car to the lot - no valet parking here.

Reviews.Title: “This ones a loser!”
Reviews.Author: davedmd
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Town for night and thought this would be a nice historical hotel on the water. For the money we paid for this place any Hotel6 would be a better choice. They should tear this dump down and rebuild it. Theres no elevator and all the rooms are on the 2nd floor. No bellboy either, pray you don't have back problems. The poll is Ice cold and dirty. The rooms are remodeled and clean but I think Motel6 rooms are much nicer. If this place was about $40/night it would be ok. But they charge Hyatt rates for this dump. The only plus is restaurant has decent food next door. Also found the staff to be friendly. Breakfast is not included with the room. The walls are paper thin and you can hear evryone in the halls and people next door. The plumbing in the shower was not draining quickly. I'm assuming it's the original plumbing from the 1900's. Look for something else in this price range, theres many other options in the area as this place will disspoint the most common person.

Reviews.Title: “Old Time Hawaii in remodelled rooms”
Reviews.Author: capndrake
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the center of Lahaina, Maui. This has the best weather on Maui and Lahaina is where the King of Maui lived (andhe could live whereever he wanted). The hotel was recently remodelled with new baths, beds, carpet and paint. It cost about 40% of the high end resorts in Kaanapala but was located at the yacht harbor where all the boat trips take off from. Very convenient. Excellent dinners at the restaurant on site, but the lunch (Kalua Pig -a pulled pork sandwich) was pretty tasteless. Try the dinners. The other reviews point out how quiet this hotel is for being downtown Lahaina, but the truth is that there is a sports bar across the street with loud music until late Saturday night. Sunday was Superbowl Sunday and there was a lot of afternoon screaming, but no loud music that night. I image that there is normally loud music every night at this popular club. Also, there is a security problem at the hotel. I don't want to tip off any bad guys, so I won't say what it is, but ask if they got the security problem fixed when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: thefriendlytraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't work out for us. It was clean, well maintained, front desk was helpful and the location is terrific, even though it is not walking distance to a beach. The problems we had were with the air conditioner and with folks in the next room sleeping out on the lanai. In most of Hawaii, we often don't need airconditioning where the trade winds are cooling. However, if you've ever been to Lahaina, you realize quickly that it gets very hot. Being located in the heart of the city doesn't make this location cooler. So you will use the window unit. That's would be ok, except that it works by cooling for about 3-5 minutes then clanking off extremely loudly. Kept us awake most of the night. Also, like a reviewer wrote a while back, it has a motion detector feature where it gets very hot in the room while you are asleep (at least it stops clanking), so you wake up sweating, get up and move around, and then the cooling, clanking begins again. In the room next to ours, they moved a roll-away bed out to the lanai and slept there. We thought maybe the hotel didn't know about it...no, the next morning we sat out on our lanai, the rollaway bed sitting unmade next to our lanai. During the day, the maids made up the bed--outside ready for the next night. The roll-away thing might have been ok if we'd paid hostel prices, but at $150 we're not expecting bunking outside! The air conditioner is a deal breaker for us no matter what, because if we can't sleep, there's no point period. We really wanted to like this hotel, it's got so much going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: lernervt
Reviews.Content: Dont even think about staying anywhere else. I agree with everything people have said above. My friend and I stayed in a standard $145 room for 2 nights. Lovely well resostored historic inn,carefully preserved with great taste. room is a litlte on the small side, but they had to work within limitations considering that it is over 100 years old. all appliances, the deck, bathroom, cortyear was perfect. free parking around the corner. several very nice beaches and diving near buy. great atmosphere and location. would go back there anytime. we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Remembrance of Capitals Past”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Pioneer Inn for two nights in July. We had stayed there two years ago, and we liked the turn of the century architecture, the free parking, and the historic central location. We had no need for a big pool, but we wanted to walk frequently between the restaurants/shops and the hotelâ€™s shade to avoid â€œthe cruel sun.â€� It feels as if, from the time Lahaina was Hawaii's capital, the rest of the city radiated outward from the boat landing and the Pioneer Hotel site. We were sad to see that the sailing ship, The Carthaginian (see photo taken July 2005), had been removed permanently from its mooring in front of the hotel and scuttled as an artificial reef, but it still can be found on the hotel's T-shirt photo. The combination of the historic light tower, wharf, the Carthaginian, and the century-old giant banyan tree and red-and-white hotel building protected by palm trees and a tall green volcanic ridge appear in many paintings and on postcards. They capture Maui's modern history in a single scene. When we booked through the Best Western website, we said that we were willing to pay for a room with a refrigerator, so we were booked in room no. 50, a larger room on the second floor with a king-sized bed. It faced the courtyard and the public library, well worth the extra cost with a bigger porch, as well. The card-key lock on the door was tricky, and sometimes it took 5-10 attempts to open it. We tried the discount coupon at the hotel's popular restaurant for breakfast, but we got a reluctant server, and they were out of English muffins. A minor quibble: macadamia nut pancakes cost $2.50+ more than regular ones, but tourists wanting to try a "local dish" will find just one or two crushed macadamia nuts on top of a regular pancake, which seemed a bit much considering you could make your own and have lots left over from a small tetrapak of macadamia nuts that sells everywhere for 69 cents. The staff at the front desk were relaxed, friendly, and casual, and the housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful--especially when we had trouble opening the door to room 50. Wireless Internet access was provided free in room 50, which is important to us when we travel. Because the hotel has the problems of an old building, we rated it above average, but we will return to the Pioneer Hotel for its excellent economic and aesthetic value; we'll skip the restaurant and go to others such as BJ's Pizza instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location - Expecially for Divers!”
Reviews.Author: divegirl605
Reviews.Content: When we first entered the Pioneer Inn we were dissapointed. The rooms are smallish, kinda old decor, there's no parking onsite and no elevator to ease the pain of hauling your own dive gear. But the next morning we realized how good we really had it. The Pioneer Inn is directly across from the harbor where the dive boat departs and - thanks to an incorrectly set alarm clock - we would have missed the boat if we weren't right across the street! Furthermore, this place is right in the heart of old Lahaina town and so centrally located we could walk everywhere. The balcony was huge and great for setting out dive gear (i recommend a courtyard view room for this) and you can't beat the price. Our friends stayed at a fancy hotel, paid twice as much and then had to pay for parking when they came to Lahaina - which is where we hung out all the time. [--] coffee is located in the building and it was awesome to get your coffee early in the morning an walk around before everyone else decends on the town. Recommend Lahaina Divers for a great diving experience. Recommended Dining: Kimos, Cool Cat Cafe, Roy's, and Lahaina Coolers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lots of character”
Reviews.Author: yellowjacket22
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui 4 times now and I've stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali, the Embassy Suites (back when it was a hotel), and the Grand Wailea previously. Since I was going to Maui on my latest trip alone I decided to be a bit more economical and stayed at the Pioneer Inn. I'd noticed it on previous visits and a co-worker who had stayed here recommended it. The rates are comparatively very good and the location is great since I'm a big fan of Lahaina. I stayed here for 5 nights in Sept. '06 when I was on Maui for the marathon weekend races. The race starts were just a short drive up the coast...maybe 10 mins. tops which wasn't a problem at all. Not having a beach right outside my door wasn't a problem either in my case especially since I love putting the windows down on my rental car and turning up some local tunes on the radio and enjoying the drive. I went to several different spectacular beaches all up and down the coast which I think is the best way to see Maui anyway. I'd do this even if I were at one of the higher end resorts. While at the Pioneer Inn I really enjoyed getting up for sunrise in the mornings and sitting on the seawall which was right outside my door and watching Lanai light up as the sun hit it. I also enjoyed watching the local kids surfing right in front of the hotel before they went off to school in the mornings and again in the evenings. I liked the idea that the locals seemed to congregate at a small park right outside the hotel by the seawall. This spot is one of the most relaxing I have ever experienced. I enjoyed walking the streets of Lahaina in the evenings also and meeting some of the local characters...and they have their share...and you will meet them unless you make an effort not to. All of this was right there surrounding the hotel, so I loved it. As for the hotel itself, being a history fan, I enjoyed the character of the place and the old feel of it. My room was fairly large and clean if not overly plush. It's not the Westin or the Grand Wailea, but it is perfectly functional and I didn't spend much time there anyway other than to sleep. The balcony was a bit public, but that was charming to me. My room overlooked the banyan tree and I actually enjoyed hearing the birds when I sat outside. I wasn't bothered by them at all when the door was closed and I was sleeping. The a/c in my room was fine and not loud at all as a previous reviewer noted. I liked the interior window shutters that actually worked rather than being for decoration. They do help keep out the noise and light also. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. I had breakfast twice in the hotel restaurant and it was very good. I recommend it. Sitting out on the lanai watching the town come alive in the morning was very nice. Parking was a couple of blocks away which you may want to know ahead of time, but it was free and walking through the streets of Lahaina is fun anyway. Had a great visit and plan to return this September. I'd recommend it to anyone not determined to stay at a luxurious resort on a beach. Those places are great too, but for a relaxed low key vacation this place is it.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated Historic Inn with some problems”
Reviews.Author: oldworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Historic Hotel in the centre of Lahaina with very attractive external appearance. The rooms were designed for a very different and older era and are dark and appear small and fairly cramped. The historic design of the balconies incorporated no privacy screening and so were effectively shared in common. Better, of course, than nothing at all. The common areas were not kept clean. Dirt (e.g. old corn plasters, refuse, etc.) was left on the stairs throughout the stay and there was no evidence that any cleaning of the common areas took place at all, which detracted from the expectation of a memorable stay due to the prime location. Similarly the pool area in the courtyard needed a good brush out although the water appeared clear, but the overall ambience was not inviting and it was notable that no other guests were seen to use it either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to soak up the unique atmosphere of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Lincoln
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pioneer Inn for a week in April/May 2006 during a three week trip to Maui and the Big Island. We knew there was no beach nearby but chose to base ourselves here for the night life â€“ accepting that it would be quite a long drive to our favourite beach. We stayed in a Queen room (46) overlooking the plantation style courtyard. The room was small, but we expected that in an historic inn. It was furnished in a style suited to the age of the building and unlike a recent reviewer we had no complaints about cleanliness. Our only regret was that we had not paid extra to have a room with a refrigerator, but there was an ice machine just down the hall. As the room faced the courtyard it was very quiet, the only time we were disturbed was when a fellow guest spent an age loudly trying to book a Luâ€™au on his cell phone on an adjoining balcony. One of the nicest aspects of this hotel is if you eat breakfast (15% reduction for residents) in the hotel restaurant you are only a few feet from where the passengers from the cruise ships disembark for excursions â€“ a great place to people watch! It did however strike us as rather sad that some people coming ashore to an island with as much to see as Maui seem to choose just to spend their day playing golf. We were impressed by the standard of the food in the restaurant for breakfast but with there being so many places to eat in Lahaina we did not eat there in the evening. The food was reasonably priced, with a varied selection. We didnâ€™t have a problem with the fact that parking was a short walk away, other than you had to remember to pick up a new parking permit each day. You could drop and pick up luggage at the hotel, even when a cruise ship was in port and the area in front of the hotel was partly cordoned off. We found all the staff to be really friendly and helpful, even the handyman who had to fix the air conditioning in out room (turned out he only needed to replace the batteries in the remote). It was our fourth trip to Lahaina, previously staying at Lahaina Shores and the Plantation Inn. We took quite a long time deciding where to stay this time. We have stayed at the Plantation Inn twice (for two nights each time) and adore that hotel, but for a longer stay the rooms are just too small unless you are prepared to upgrade to one of the suites. We were also more than happy with Lahaina Shores (we stayed for 10 nights) which despite its historic facade has all the amenities of a modern condominium but it is quite a dark walk back at night from the main attractions in Front Street. On balance we felt we made the right decision this time and will stay here again on our next trip to Maui. Itâ€™s the perfect place to stay if you really want to soak up the unique atmosphere of Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again and again”
Reviews.Author: jmartinez
Reviews.Content: We had traveled to Maui many times and always made the comment that some day we would love to stay at this hotel. We finally booked a weeks vacation in Febuary and could not of been more pleased. From the time we arrived we were treated very well indeed and had no complaints. The room was small but very clean and pleasant. Yes the parking is about a block and a half away but it really is no problem. We will return to Maui again and again and knowing that we can stay any where we want we will choose The Pioneer Inn over and over. We really were that pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: JimboF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 6/9/06 through 6/13/06 and loved it. The location cant be beat, right in the heart of this quaint town. The room was on the small side but clean and besides, who stays in the room in maui except to sleep. The noise from outside is not bad, only one of the nites that we stayed(thursday) u could hear the music faintly(over the A/C) outside until 2am. The rest of the nites were very quiet. Parking is included in the price and was about a block and a half away, which was great because parking is not easy in lahaina. The beach is a 5min drive to kaanapali. The pool is small but very nice with tropical vegetation around it. The town is great with all the small shops/restaurants. We just loved this place and didnt want to leave. We highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “I don't get all these positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: MinMemphis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pioneer Inn for four nights at the end of June. Prior to our trip, we were encouraged by all the positive reviews read on this site. And upon my return I see yet more positive reviews. I'm not one to post a review like this, but I believe in this case people need to hear another side of this story. Let me start with the positive aspects of the hotel. 1) Price - if you don't want to break the bank, this place is certainly affordable. 2) Location - Lahaina is a fun town and you're right in the middle of it. Now for the negatives. 1) The rooms are small, outdated, and felt dirty. The furnishings and ambience of our room was straight from the late 70's / early 80's. 2) Our air conditioner constantly froze up, was increadible noisy, and basically made staying there miserable. You obviously need a functioning AC unit in Hawaii and we didn't have it. Each time it froze we were instructed to turn it off for a half-hour (is this really customer service?). It was so noisy you couldn't sleep. Be warned - all AC units here are window units and, at least in our case, it didn't work at all. 3) Location - as far as beach access, there isn't any. As mentioned above, great for going out and/or dining, but horrible for getting to the beach. 4) Service - or lack of it. You know about the AC unit mentioned above. They promised to move us to another room after multiple calls about the unit. The next day theys said they could no longer accomodate a move. Also just seemed to not care about you stay / experience in general. If I had it to do over again, I would have shelled out $50 - $75 more per night and stayed at any of the much nicer hotel options. I was very disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Book A Reception Here!”
Reviews.Author: ramblin1
Reviews.Content: We booked our daughter's wedding reception dinner here. Mark is the food and bev mgr. Reception planning is WAY above his head. He would not return phone calls from the beginning... had us booked for wrong date (of course, had he returned phone calls, this could have been cleared up instantly!). Mark hired a grubby bartender who was also the owner of the stereo system... and rather than use our professionally pre-recorded music, used HIS! When the toasts were given, we had to wait for Mark to open the champaigne and pour it;when it was time to cut the cakes... Mark had forgotten to provide a knife; after the cakes were cut, my daughter actually went back into the kitchen in her wedding gown and asked where the slices of cake were... it had been 30 minutes! For the 32 of us, Mark only had one waitress. This was a nightmare. If you want to have a special, relaxing, fun reception after your daughter's wedding, DO NOT BOOK AT THE PIONEER INN! The entire staff was totally unprofessional. I will NEVER recommend them to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a younger female who, because of a last min. decision to go to Hawaii, had to travel to Maui a day earlier than my parents. I was a little nervous as this was one of the first times traveling alone. I chose to stay in the Pioneer Inn for one night before my parents arrived and we would be moving to the Ritz in Kapalua. I felt completely safe and the staff were very helpful. Throughout my stay in Hawaii I stayed at the Ritz and the Grand Waliea and I have to say the Pioneer Inn ranked right up there with them if not my favorite. The hotel and the town has great history and I found the rooms to be very comfortable and cute. The staff was amazing, the nearby resteraunts great(walk a few blocks down to the beach and eat at pacifico and I'o they were great.) I had a room facing front street with a very nice balcony. From what I can tell these rooms have the best views. While the Pioneer Inn is not great for lounging by the pool (it is nice, mostly shaded but small) and walking straight on to the beach(the hotel is right on the harbor and many people go surfing steps from the hotel but it is a 5 minute walk to the sand beach), it has a great harbor, tons of island shopping and eating. It is a great place to stay as there are a lot of activities in this town and it is in the middle of all the action. I would certainly book this hotel again, I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the middle of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: sassywahine
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 amazing nights with my guy at the Pioneer Inn in downtown Lahaina. I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised by the staff, the setting, the rooms, dining, comfort, cleanliness, and the list continues. The details made all the difference, from the genuine, unforced smiles from every staff member to the personal greeting at any time of day, to the valentines day heart cookies waiting for us all day on february 14th, we were well looked after at this hotel. And nothing fancy? I beg to differ - the minute you walk into this impeccably restored historic building you feel as though you're transported back to a time when shutters on the windows were commonplace, as were verandas, high ceilings with beautiful moldings and the most comfortable mattress I experienced anywhere on Maui. It was more intimate, clean, and welcoming (and yet quiet and cool in the middle of evening rush hour chaos), than any resort you could stay at. And all this with the convenience of the most central location in all of Lahaina. I could not get over how quiet our room was, how charming and spacious it was, and how friendly the staff were. They took the time to learn our names for our brief two-night stay! And although you may be in a historic building, you can access a multitude of channels on the television - we even found Canadian coverage of the Olympics during our stay, which I could not find at any other hotel in Hawaii! Everything is so impeccably restored, and decorated in a subtle, classy way so as to remain warm and hawaiian, while not looking tawdry or stark. The next time I come to Maui, I will not be staying anywhere else. Great pancakes too!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF AND LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a staff that is incredible. They will go the extra mile, or 10 if necessary to make your stay a winner. It is not fancy, it is not luxurious but it is home. While you are there, it is like you are a long lost cousin and have found your way home. All of Maui is like that to me for the most part, however it is over the top at the Pioneer Inn. I don't stay there for an entire 2 week stay, but I love to stay for 3 or 4 nights on the front end and at the end of a stay. It is part of the Ambience of Maui. I think it is also the oldest hotel west of the Rockies. And has a heck of a history. I get up early in the morning and take a walk along the coast. There is no place better for this on the planet. The Restaurant and bar are good too and have good prices. If you want fine dining there are several with in walking distance.I liked Lahina Seafood Company just a block or 2 down the street. Go about 9PM. get a table by the water, it is unbeatable. I recommend it highly. I have been to Maui several times and would be happy to give anyone more info or answer questions or give opinions to anyone about things to do etc. bob@oldcolonialmortgage(-)

Reviews.Title: “do stay for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: hulahulagirl
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night but will certainly stay a few more when we come back. The location is great - right across from the harbour and Banyan Square. Our room was clean and comfortable. As non-smokers we didn't have much choice of room location - why is this the case in so many hotels when hardly anyone smokes these days? The staff were relaxed and friendly (they found and held onto my lost coat) and the adjoining restaurant is great for breakfast. If you want to do any boat journeys or enjoy any of Lahaina's bars and restaurants then do these while staying in Lahaina and avoid the traffic and taxi fares. Food tips, the cheapest meal we had in Maui was a tasty taco from a late night taco stand off the main shopping road. Making me a bit hungry thinking about it now in fact. Novice surfers note that you are within walking distance to one of Maui's best learner breaks so grab a lesson or two but don't - as I did - step on a sea urchin. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: snapdragen
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Pioneer Inn. I hadn't been to Maui in 20 years; the Pioneer was perfect and as far away from the over built Kaanapali as possible. When I checked in, they wanted to give me a courtyard room, but I requested a park view. I was warned about the birds; I found their singing madness in the evening a delight. Others might be bothered by them. The Front street noise didn't bother me at all, the only disturbance was my neighbor on his cell phone at 4 in the morning. Maybe they need to post a notice that the lanai is not a private phone booth? The only change I'd like to see is a small refrigerator in all rooms - would have come in handy for a small carton of milk for my morning coffee! All of Lahaina is at your doorstep here, I'll definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No fancy resort, but a good value”
Reviews.Author: Bellybones
Reviews.Content: The oldest hotel in town, the Pioneer Inn, is a local landmark. Itâ€™s smack in the middle of Lahaina. I stayed there with my wife and 3 boys (ages 11, 9, and 5). Itâ€™s not a place I would want to spend a week at, but for a night or two it has a great location while capturing the feel of Lahaina and its kooky, touristy fun. The Pioneer Inn was built in 1901 and was the only hotel in western Maui until 1964. Itâ€™s now under the Best Western banner. There is a plaque at the registration desk citing them as one of the top Best Westerns in the country. Iâ€™m not surprisedâ€¦it was definitely the best Best Western I have ever stayed at. They had a set of rules posted by the desk from when the hotel first opened. Some of them are pretty funny such as â€œIf you burn or wet you bed, you going outâ€� and â€œYou are not allow in the down stears in the seating room or in the dinering room or in the kitchen when you are drunk.â€�. Fortunately, the boys remained sober and enjoyed climbing the banyan tree next door for nearly an hour. We had a great lunch at Aloha Mixed Plate and the boys satisfied their pizza jones at B.J.â€™s that night. You will not lack for dining choices in Lahaina. Our room was a â€œsuiteâ€�, although there was no separate sitting room. It was very spacious, however. We had a king bed and a queen pull-down Murphy bed. The hotel also has pretty decent and FREE wireless high-speed Internet access. There was a small lanai that overlooks an inner courtyard. You have no privacy on the lanaiâ€”itâ€™s more a motel-like internal open hallway with the lanais separated by open wooden fences. Our room overlooking the garden was very peaceful, however. A number of rooms overlook the main drag, Front Street. I would imagine they could be pretty noisy and/or excellent vantage points for first-class people watching, depending on your mood. The room was very clean and everything was in working order. Reception staff was gracious and friendly. All-in-all, this is no fancy resort, but is a very good value. I would definitely stay again. The morning we checked out we had excellent, plate-covering macadamia nut pancakes in the hotelâ€™s restaurant. A nice cap to a nice stay. When youâ€™re in Lahaina you look at the pretty green clapboard siding of the Pioneer Inn with its white trim and you say to yourself, â€œgee, I wish I could stay in a place like thatâ€�. Well, you can.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' the action!”
Reviews.Author: kimbalya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed across from the Banyan Tree. We could sit out on our veranda and watch the people under the B tree, the boat people and the shoppers. Loved listening to the bands. By 10:PM it was pretty quiet. Mornings were early with busses, birds and people but if your door was closed you could not hear much. The staff was really friendly. We had the pool to ourselves. The rooms were clean and comfortable. (felt like the OLD WEST) I really liked being closed to all the shops, restaraunts, and bars. We took the $1 shuttle to the beach and then walked the 4-5 miles back. This was my 1st trip and I hope to return very soon. I would recommend Banyan side as you will have scenery & action. My most memorable part of Lahaina was the beautiful sunny, calm weather. Lahaina reminded me of Banff, AB.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere of good times past”
Reviews.Author: Poves
Reviews.Content: We are two retired Brits who have no desire to stay in cloned "anywhere" chain hotels so we chose the Poineer on the internet. What a brilliant choice. The shade of the trees as we stepped from out rental car, the colonial atmosphere and the pleasant smile of the receptionist, boded well. We were not to be disappointed. The Pioneer was an oasis of calm. Our room was facing the park where craft stalls were set up each day. The room had recently been renovated and other rooms were undergoing the same treatment. It was clean, simple, charming and comfortable. The Verandah (Lanai to non Brits) was huge cool and a most pleasant place to relax in the evening prior to eating. The centre courtyard with its small pool could have been somebody's well tended garden. We worried a little about noise but being away from the main drag it was tolerable. I am not so sure about rooms on the landward side. After the madness of Waikiki it was like a soothing balm. If we are allowed one gripe it would only be the steep narrow stairs.... but its worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Pioneer Inn. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room had a nice view of the banyon tree and dock. Hotel was very clean and you can't beat the location. The only drawbacks were parking was three blocks away (understandable) and the desk didn't tell me that they wouldn't be there until 730am the next day to check me out. I found out through a security guard who secured my luggage until they arrived. I did find out later that it was written at the front desk to settle accounts the night before if you leave before 730 the next day but one would have to look for it..Still a great place to stay and will definitely stay there again next year.
